name: Shanghai 21
address: 21 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: Hop Kee 21 Restaurant

I keep track of their specials better than their website does. Nice setting that works. The workers here provide warm service with careful attention. This place performs well consistently. This spot is exceptional and will see me frequently.
Pretty solid dumplings.
éš¾ä»¥ç½®ä¿¡åœ¨Chinatownåƒäº†ä¸€é¡¿ç¾å¼ä¸­é¤ã€‚

Edit: I still come here, 6 years after this review was last edited, even though I've moved 200+ miles away. Best soup dumplings. Always worth the wait.

I gave this five stars over a year ago and I stand by that. I take everyone who visits me in NYC to this place for soup dumplings. The Crab meat and pork ones are my favorite. Just a heads up that they're cash only (or Amex) and there is often a wait, especially for parties larger than 2! But I love coming here. Love it. I've lost count of how many times I've been!

Kau Fu was roughly made, and its presentation was awful! The Kau Fu was too big and needed to chop into smaller chunks.  The whole dish was sugary. The wine chicken was salty. It's not the typical chicken that's used for this dish. They used a much bigger chicken with thicker meat. The traditional soup dumplings with pork was OK but not my type. These dumplings are with thick flour wraps, and I prefer thin skins. I would not come back and I would choose a different shop nearby.

Remember Shanghai Asian Cuisine (closed) On Elizabeth St? Same menu - Same quality taste. Juicy expertly crafted XLB with thin skin, pork, crab and truffle variety.  Crispy scallion pancakes. Spicy wonton with chili oil. All the hits.
DeuxiÃ¨me visite dans ce restaurant dont un l'an passÃ© toujours aussi bon et copieux  a recommander pour passer un bon moment a table +++++
Excellent food, always good always consistent. Friendly staff, knowledgeable about their menu items.

If you want to taste authentic and delicious Chinese food in the heart of Chinatown, New York, this is a great option. I tried the House Special Pork Chop with Noodles in Soup, and it was delicious and filling. If you're visiting Chinatown, you must try this restaurant. Highly recommended.
Â¡Solo pago con efectivo! Fuimos pronto y nos sirvieron muy rÃ¡pido, la comida exquisita: aunque destacariamos el General Tsoâ€™s Chicken over rice.

Lo mejor los Dumpling Soup!!! BuenÃ­simos.
Servicio rÃ¡pido y muy bien, disfrutamos mucho
Overall a good experience. Service was friendly, food came quickly. Large portions.

Good is gd  but they only take cash now so I might not go as much as I use to because I don't happen to carry cash. It so happens that I did have cash in my wallet that day other wise I might have just walked out and ate elsewhere.
Food should be improvement

Didnâ€™t live up to the reviews. I ordered the crispy duck it was too gamey and had this funny scent to it. Shrimp w scallion was as good a regular Chinese takeout. The pork dumplings w truffle were good. All in all not impressive least bit. Mediocre.
Chinigame
Very good
The food is okey, but the service is not. They were really rude with customers. By the way, they do not want to accept card payment and this is awful
Perfekt! Nice and well cooked!

Second time eating at Shanghai, and our last. Soup was mediocre at best, chicken-eggplant dish should say "chicken scraps" rather than slices. The sauce was thicker than the chicken, and the dish was drowning in sauce. Same issue with the chicken-broccoli dish. Waitress never came back to table after we were served the food. Extremely disappointing dinner.

Completely impressive by all standards. Their menu contains expected items. I appreciate the thoughtful setup and cleanliness. Staff members provide exceptional, rapid attention with remarkable food. Exceptionally delicious.
I had the pork and black truffle soup dumplings and they were amazing!
Real Chinese Cuisine in Chinatown

5/5 Crab and Pork XLB  -- maybe the most generously crab filled XLBs I've had in recent memory! Broth with the black ginger vinegar was great too!

4.5/5 Beef Pan Fried Noodles

We came on a Saturday ~5pm and there was a minimal wait for a table!

Really good shrimp dumplings and fried rice. Noodles soup were not that good.
Nice people.

Excellent service. Amazing food. All the reviews are not exaggerating about the chili oil wontons. They truly are phenomenal. I think they might dethrone white bear in flushing in my eyes. Definitely try those too if you haven't. They were perfect spicy level for me but my wife had a really low spice tolerance and they were too much for her. The scallion pancakes were very good as well. Very crispy and served with the best sauce pairing I have had. The soup dumplings were very good too. Highly recommended this place.
Very bland food, disappointing

While I only had tea and dumplings, they were absolutely top of the top. They seamlessly blend crispy bottom dumplings with soft chewy tops that give way to delicious filling. The food smelled amazing and I can't wait to come back for a more extensive meal.
Best dumplings in china town New York. Been coming for the past 6 years yearly and the consistency is crazy!! We love it here. Highly recommend!!

This place delivers true cultural dishes. Pleasant space with helpful staff and clean aesthetics. Vibrant plating showcases the freshness of their ingredients. Staff members are genuinely pleasant. Shanghai 21 delivers an impressive performance.
Stomach pain after this food. Unhelpful and rude service. In the place where we were siting we could feel toilet smell. Dirty local and toilet. I don't recommend

Ok. Another spot to highlight. The reviews didnâ€™t disappoint. Was looking for a good Chinese spot and this restaurant was having it.

Servers were quick and attentive. Food was served fast. The place was not crowded when we arrived but approaching lunch time, the restaurant got packed. Only shows that you are in a good spot.

my friend and I was there last week. food was okay, service was fast one of the workers had some inapproriate behaviour towards both of us. they might know who we are but i need to post this. we came in and there were 2 tables ( a four seats and two seats), they pointed us to the 4 one but my friend didn't hear, she walked towards the 2 seats table in a corner. i called my friend but she didn't notice and one of the worker said "bye,bye" to her. once we secured a table, and was having our dinner, my friend changed to sit next to me to charge phone and she noticed the same worker pointed finger at our table talking sth to another one. that was our experience. it was a minor one compared to a quick service we received but hope there will be change in customer service. thanks.
Comida muy buena  y buen precio, repetirÃ­a sin duda
TrÃ¨s bonne cuisine bons produits on a adorÃ© les nouilles
Cash only but there are signs that let you know.

very long wait, we waited to be sat and then we also waited a long time at the table to be greeted and have our orders taken

food was great tho: we got salt and pepper squid which was the best in my opinion. crab and pork dumplings and just pork dumplings, the crab and pork was obviously better but both were good. and my mom get beef which was super juicy and flavorful.
Very good
Para repetir

Servicio rÃ¡pido y muy bueno. Tiene mesas, pero si estÃ¡ lleno te toman nota para sentarte a comer 20-30 minutos despuÃ©s. Mucha variedad para elegir y las raciones son generalmente bastante grandes, sobretodo el arroz. Recomendable.

Bad service.
Bad food.
Great little place to eat yummy Chinese food. Service was friendly and efficient. Donâ€™t forget to bring cash to pay for your food. Wait time is typically 30 minutes
The good disappointed. Didn't taste fresh.
Iâ€™ve been here many times. It never disappoints. Service is quick, soup dumplings are tasty. Donâ€™t sleep on the lo mein!

My son found this Shanghainese restaurant in the heart of Manhattan China Town as it is near where he works.  My wife and I went without a high expectations of its authenticity especially when we walked in and found most of the customers are non-Chinese visitors.  However, all staff speak fluent Cantonese as if we were back in Hong Kong.  Everything we ordered were good and authentic especially the drunken chicken and Shanghainese noodles.  Would definitely go back when we are back in town.

Repas succulent
Dommage pas de vin...
I highly recommend this restaurant! The food is amazing and so much variety!! Reasonably priced as well. Waiter wasnâ€™t friendly but it was fine.
Un gusto comer aquÃ­ y salir de la comida rÃ¡pida,  hamburguesa y pizza. Muy buen precio.  Muy recomendable.
They said no to my egg rolls

Everything was good, but not five star. Service was profesional, friendly, and quick enough. Quality was good. At least the place was clean and we didnâ€™t have any stomach issue the day after. Food was all alright. We ordered soup dumplings, scallion pancake (that didnâ€™t have much scallion), Shanghai fried rice, and Shanghai lo mien. The fried rice was the best among the four. Other patrons were not loud. So thatâ€™s a plus. You also donâ€™t hear all the noise from the kitchen. They also offered cash payment thatâ€™s less than the credit card one. So overall, itâ€™s more like 4.3/5.0.

You know, when you're scrambling for a last-minute birthday dinner in New York, you don't always expect perfection. But Shanghai 21? They squeezed our lively bunch in like seasoned pros, and what followed was a truly hilarious and delicious experience.
First off, let's talk about the "non-alcoholic" part. We discovered this little detail upon arrival, which for a birthday dinner, was... an interesting twist! Imagining a sober toast with sparkling water was pretty amusing, but honestly, the food was so outrageously good, we barely noticed the lack of bubbly.
And what food it was! We gorged ourselves on the most gorgeous, delicious Chinese food I've had in ages. Every dish was a winner, from the perfectly steamed dumplings to the flavourful noodles. And the best part? The bill didn't make our eyes water â€“ it was all incredibly reasonably priced. So if you're looking for a fantastic, funny, and surprisingly sober culinary adventure in NYC, Shanghai 21 is your spot. Just be prepared for a very clear-headed evening!

We planned a Chinatown day while in NYC and on a Tuesday! We didnâ€™t realize most of the places are closed but this wasnâ€™t! The food was phenomenal and loved everything here

Food : We got scallion pancakes, super crunchy and yum, Spring rolls (definitely have had better), soup dumplings and spicy wonton. All were yum!

Service : Quick and simple!

Atmosphere : A very family style restaurant! Loved the homely vibes it has

Definitely a popular spot but thankfully didnâ€™t have to wait long for a table at lunch time on a Saturday. We were doing a self-guided dumpling tour so ate light here with only pork soup dumplings and pork buns. The soup dumplings were good, but they lacked some flavor. The dough was great though. I would say if the two dishes, preferred the pork buns.

Worth the wait in my opinion! Some of the most flavorful soup dumplings I've had in the US. Everything else we tried was also delicious. I wish we could have tried more dishes, but we were short on time. Service was pretty good considering how busy they were. Prices were very reasonable. I'd be happy to come back!
This is there best Asian food I have ever had. I live in Cleveland Iâ€™ve been here twice. Every time I come to NYC I have to stop by. There is always a wait but itâ€™s never more than 30 minutes

General Tso Chicken, scallion pancake, and siu mai were absolutely fantastic. They set a different standard and to be honest the beef siu mai was the best Iâ€™ve EVER had. It melts in your mouth and is full of flavor. The sambal they too was excellent. And for the price everything is great. This place is cash only so prepare in advance. This is a place I can see myself showing off to my friends and taking my wife on dates too because it checks all the boxes at least for the items I ordered. I will be back to try more.

Shanghai 21 in Chinatown, New York City, is a popular spot for authentic Shanghainese cuisine. Known for its **soup dumplings**, which are praised for their thin skin and flavorful broth, the restaurant offers a variety of dishes like scallion pancakes, pan-fried noodles, and double sautÃ©ed pork with hot sauce.

The atmosphere is vibrant, and it's a great place for casual dining or sharing meals with friends.

Hint: Prices are moderate
